title: Google Pixel crashed and now only mounting to PC as "Qualcomm HS-USB QDLoader 9008"
content:
How did the issue occur: I tried to launch the youtube app, the phone froze and would not boot back up

Issue: Phone does not boot, mounts to coumputer as "Qualcomm HS-USB QDLoader 9008"
(The device can be forced into fastboot with some patience, when you select "START" it bootloops and ends up with a black screen again, starting the recovery works)

Things that I tried & do not work:
Reset device via fastboot
Reflash stock rom via fastboot (tells me the system is too large to write)
Reflash stock rom via ADB (also cannot write system)
Format data via fastbooted TWRP (worked, didn't help)
Delete cache, fails with "< waiting for any device >
Erasing 'cache'                                    (bootloader) Erasing active slot "_b"
FAILED (remote: 'Partition table doesn't exist
')
Finished. Total time: 0.165s"
This leads me to believe that the partition table got deleted

Is there any way to fix this?
